summary: This document is an email chain from August 13, 2019, among federal prosecutors and investigators, providing updates on interviews conducted regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. It details interviews with MCC staff, refusals by correctional officers to speak without union representation, and reveals failures in protocol such as Epstein not having a cellmate and missed inmate counts.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Recipient and sender of emails in the chain, asking questions and receiving updates about the investigation into Epstein's death at MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC on August 10, 2019. The emails discuss the circumstances leading to his death.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: MCC officer who was present when Epstein's body was discovered. She reported Epstein had hung himself and admitted to not conducting required inmate counts.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: MCC officer who was performing CPR on Epstein when discovered. Admitted to not conducting required inmate counts.

persons.name: al.
persons.context: Oversees the whole prison and stated he had given oral commands that Epstein needed a cellmate at all times following an earlier incident.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers on duty in the SHU when Epstein's body was discovered and both admitted to failing to conduct required inmate counts.
M., as an operations lieutenant, questioned Officer Noel about protocol failures regarding Epstein's cellmate after Epstein's death was discovered.
E. assisted Epstein with making a phone call a few days before his death, dialing a number for him and overhearing his conversation.
al., as a captain, stated he had given oral commands to his staff that Epstein needed a cellmate at all times following an earlier incident.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, was overseeing the prosecution of Epstein and is now involved in the investigation into his death.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Officer Noel reported he had hung himself. Officer Thomas was performing CPR.

events.title: Cellmate Removed, Protocol Failures
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was moved out of his cell. Despite a memo reporting Epstein would need a new cellmate, one was not assigned. Multiple officers failed to conduct required 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.

events.title: Voluntary Interviews of MCC Staff
events.description: The OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted voluntary interviews with several MCC employees, including lieutenants and a duty officer, regarding the events surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Officers Refuse Interviews
events.description: Multiple correctional officers, including those who discovered Epstein and those on duty on August 9, refused to meet with FBI agents without their union representatives present.

keyFacts: Epstein did not have a cellmate on the night of August 9-10, 2019, despite protocol requiring one following an earlier incident.
Correctional Officers Noel and Thomas admitted to not conducting the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts on the night Epstein died.
Multiple MCC officers and supervisors were aware Epstein lacked a cellmate but did not reassign one.
Several correctional officers, including those who found Epstein, refused to be interviewed by the FBI without their union representatives.
The camera system in the SHU where Epstein was held was not working at the time of his death.
